business.headline: Advance tax alert: First instalment due by June 15, find out if you are liableAdvance tax simply means paying your income tax in parts throughout the year, instead of waiting till the end. If your total tax due for the year is more than Rs 10,000, then you must pay it in advance in four instalments.
Iran-Israel tensions rise. Why India should worryThe escalating Iran-Israel conflict poses significant challenges for India, particularly concerning oil imports and economic stability.

Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

Oswal Pumps opens Rs 1,387 crore IPO with strong brokerage backingOswal Pumps targets Rs 1,387.34 crore from IPO. Experts recommend subscribing due to strong fundamentals. IPO open until June 17, 2025.

Air India crash rattles hotel and ticketing stocks, as investor confidence waversOnline travel companies were among the most affected. Shares of Thomas Cook India fell by 2.39%, trading at Rs 160.03 as of June 13, 1PM. TBO Tek dropped 1.10% to Rs 1,287.40, while Mahindra Holidays slipped 1.47% to Rs 342.35.

Air India crash: How airline insurance works and why premiums may riseIncidents like the recent Air India crash can result in a total loss, meaning the aircraft is beyond repair with no salvageable parts. In such cases, the losses can reach around $130 million, roughly $80 million for the plane and $30-50 million in liabilities.

Who are the likely insurers for Air India plane crash?The plane involved in the crash was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, one of the most modern aircraft used in commercial aviation. It was carrying 242 people, including 12 crew members.

Boeing's revival on trial after deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in AhmedabadThe fatal crash of Air India flight AI-171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad, has killed 241 people on board, reigniting serious doubts over Boeing's aircraft safety and corporate oversight.

Oil shock hits Dalal Street: BPCL, ONGC, IOC, other crude-sensitive stocks fallBrent crude oil futures jumped more than 9% to touch around $75.61 per barrel, reaching a multi-month high. The gain came after Israel said it had launched what it called "preemptive strikes" against Iran.

RBI steps in to contain fallout of oil price jump on rupee: ReportThe Indian rupee dropped to 86.20 against the US dollar in early trade but later recovered to 86.04, helped by the central bank's likely intervention.

Aviation stocks tumble after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadSpiceJet's share price dropped 3.42% at the start of the trading session. InterGlobe Aviation Ltd, the company that runs IndiGo, also fell 4.83%, slipping to Rs 5,212 in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty crash as Israel attacks Iran; oil prices jump sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 838.78 points to 80,853.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 252.80 points to 24,635.40 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex falls over 1,100 points. Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was down 1121.35 points to 80,570.63 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 334.65 points to trade at 24,553.55.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over Israel-Iran conflict?The situation in the Middle East has affected global investor sentiment. Oil prices also jumped on fears that the strikes could affect supply from the region, which is known for producing large amounts of oil.

Stocks to watch on June 13: Tata Group, RIL, HCL, Asian Paints, ICRA, ICICI BankShares of several Tata Group companies, such as Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Tata Chemicals, are expected to remain in the spotlight after the crash of Air India flight AI171 in Ahmedabad shortly after takeoff.

Boeing shares slide 5% after Air India Dreamliner crash kills over 200Flight AI171, bound for London, went down minutes after departure, killing more than 200 people in what is now the world's deadliest aviation disaster in a decade. The cause of the crash remains unclear.

Tata Group to give Rs 1 crore to families of Ahmedabad Air India crash victimsTata Group will offer Rs 1 crore to family members of people who lost their lives in the Ahmedabad crash of Air India Flight 171, which killed over 200 people on Thursday.

This is a difficult day for us: Air India CEO reacts to Ahmedabad plane crashAt least 204 people were killed and 41 injured after the London-bound Air India flight crashed just minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

Retail inflation hits six-year low, falls to 2.82% in May 2025The decline in retail inflation is mainly because food prices rose at a much slower pace than before. Cheaper vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses helped bring food inflation down sharply. In May, food inflation fell to 0.99% from 1.78% in April.

Sensex tanks 823 points, Nifty falls below 25,000; Tata Motors falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 823.16 points to close at 81,691.98, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 253.20 points to settle at 24,888.20.

Boeing reacts to Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, says aware of initial reportsThe London-bound flight AI-171, carrying 242 people including 230 passengers and 12 crew members, crashed in the Meghaninagar area near the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport minutes after takeoff. The plane had issued a mayday call before losing contact with air traffic control.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Focus on supporting affected people: Tata Group chief on Ahmedabad plane crashThe airplane crash has led to a temporary suspension of flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

Boeing shares tumble 8% after Air India flight crashes in AhmedabadBoeing shares nosedived over 8% in pre-market trade after the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, deepening investor concerns over the jetmaker's safety record and regulatory troubles.

Google offers buyout plans amid AI-focused overhaul: ReportGoogle is now giving some employees the option to leave the company with a severance package. This is being called a "voluntary exit programme", as per reports.

Dalal Street dips nearly 1 percent on global trade and geopolitical concernsStock market today: The fall occurred despite markets erasing early losses as the S&P BSE Sensex fell by 911 points to 81,603.95 and the NSE Nifty50 lost 288.75 points to 24,854.45 by 2:29 pm.

India to tighten remittance rules, bar offshore time deposits: ReportThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will amend regulations to prevent overseas transfers from being used to park money in time deposits or other interest-bearing accounts abroad, one of the sources said.

PM-Kisan 20th instalment: When will farmers get the next Rs 2,000?This scheme provides income support of Rs 6,000 a year to eligible farmers. The money is paid in three equal parts of Rs 2,000, directly into the farmers' bank accounts.

Dollar dream vs reality: Why Rs 80 lakh in US salary not as big as it soundsRs 23 lakh in India can go as far as Rs 80 lakh in the US when it comes to daily living costs. An upcoming author reveals the impact of Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) on salary comparisons between India and the US.
Elon Musk's net worth jumps after apology to Donald TrumpElon Musk's net worth increased by $191 million, reaching $411.4 billion after his public apology to President Donald Trump.

Got an income tax notice? Don't panic, here's how to deal with itFor many honest taxpayers, the unexpected arrival of an income tax notice in their inbox can trigger anxiety. However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

India's AI market to triple by 2027 with strong talent and tech growthThe report, titled "India's AI Leap: BCG Perspective on Emerging Challengers," indicates that the country is set to become one of the fastest-growing AI economies globally.

Paytm shares slide up to 10% after government dismisses MDR rumoursPaytm shares fell sharply in early trade after the government rejected reports suggesting the return of merchant discount rate (MDR) charges on UPI transactions.

Tanla Platforms shares jump 13% today. Check what's driving the rallyTanla Platforms share price: At around 10:10 am, shares of the company were trading 9.96% higher at Rs 684.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

India, EU nearly 90% ready on market access in FTA talks, says Piyush GoyalPiyush Goyal also underlined the political backing behind the deal, referring to the meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in New Delhi on 28 February.
Sensex, Nifty erase early losses to trade in green; IT stocks limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 89.24 points to 82,604.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.45 points to 25,163.80 as of 9:27 am.

Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty likely to open flat. Here's whyAs of 8:34 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,236.5, suggesting that the Nifty 50 index will open close to Wednesday's closing level of 25,141.4.

Stocks to watch on June 12: Wipro, HDFC Bank, IREDA, Nazara Tech, NTPCThe Sensex and Nifty closed higher after a rangebound session on Wednesday. While gains in IT stocks supported the indices, profit booking and the absence of strong triggers limited the overall rise.

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.

entertainment.headline: Anirudh Ravichander quashes wedding reports: Stop spreading rumoursComposer Anirudh Ravichander has finally addressed the speculations about his alleged wedding with Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) owner Kavya Maran.

Dharmendra suggested Big B for Sholay, convinced Ramesh Sippy he'd be perfectVeteran actor Dharmendra opened up about recommending Amitabh Bachchan for the role of Jai in 'Sholay'. He reflected on Big B's impressive quality as a young actor in the 70s.

Diljit Dosanjh, Imtiaz Ali reunite for untitled film with Sharvari and Vedang RainaFilmmaker Imtiaz Ali is set to reunite with Diljit Dosanjh for their upcoming film. Set to begin filming in August 2025, this untitled film will hit theatres on Baisakhi 2026.

Taylor Swift surprises young fans at Florida hospital with gifts. See picsTaylor Swift paid a surprise visit to a children's hospital in the US shortly after attending boyfriend Travis Kelce's Stanley Cup finals game.

Dakota Johnson slams Hollywood remakes, says its all a messActor Dakota Johnson recently criticised Hollywood's obsession with remakes. She reflected on the risk-averse nature of the entertainment industry, while highlighting the challenges.

Jackson Wang on Magic Man 2, Love and Trust, bond with RM, Diljit Dosanjh, MM India Tour | ExclusiveIn an exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, global star Jackson Wang opens up about his upcoming album Magic Man 2, second visit to India, his collaboration with Diljit Dosanjh, the emotional and creative process behind it, and what turning 31 has meant for him. Jackson speaks candidly about navigating life without a label, how he still approaches trust with caution, and what vulnerability with fans truly looks like for him.

Squid Game 3 trailer: Lee Jung-jae faces his toughest opponents in epic finaleThe new trailer for 'Squid Game Season 3' was released on June 14. The show featuring actor Lee Jung-jae is all set for its finale and will premiere on June 27 on Netflix.

Who's paying you to provoke me? Justin Bieber in heated clash with paparazziSinger Justin Bieber got into a heated clash with the paparazzi outside the Soho House in Malibu. Bieber was protecting himself from the flashing cameras before delivering a firm and expletive-filled message to the photographers.

Thug Life box office Day 9: Kamal Haasan's film crawls towards Rs 50 croreActor Kamal Haasan and filmmaker Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' saw a massive decline in the box office collection on day nine. The film is still far behind the Rs 50 crore-mark.

Bhai is still with us: Sushant Singh Rajput's sister shares emotional videoSushant Singh Rajput's sister, Shweta, remembered her brother on his fifth death anniversary today, June 14. In an emotional video, she discussed missing her late actor-brother while also explaining what he stood for.

BTS FESTA 2025: Blood, Sweat, and Tears- The 7 are back and so is the magicBTS FESTA 2025 saw an emotional reunion of all seven members during J-hope's concert, thrilling fans across the globe. The event was a perfect blend of nostalgia, joy, and promise of a bright future for the band and ARMY alike.

Thug Life makers slam Karnataka government over threats: No FIR was registeredThug Life makers slammed the Karnataka government for not protecting them against threats following Kamal Haasan's 'Kannada born out of Tamil' remark. They claimed that no FIR was registered.

Housefull 5 box office Day 8: Akshay Kumar's entertainer eyes Rs 150 crore-markAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' is witnessing a dip in box office numbers. On its eighth day, the film collected Rs 6 crore, bringing its total India earnings to over Rs 133 crore.

Are we living in spoiler-verse? Is pre-release content killing the hype for films?Is the film industry today grappling with overexposure, where trailers and promos reveal too much? Experts and filmmakers urge a balanced marketing approach to preserve the magic of discovery and keep viewers emotionally connected to the story.

Bipasha Basu slams trolls over postpartum weight gain, husband Karan shows supportActor Bipasha Basu addressed the online buzz about her weight gain post-motherhood in a recent Instagram post. She slammed trolls and wrote how they don't define her identity or self-worth.

Dipika Kakar discharged from hospital after surgery: Free from the tumourActor Dipika Kakar has been discharged from Kokilaben Hospital. In her health update, Kakar said that the tumour has been successfully removed.

The Traitors Season 4 begins filming with Alan Cumming and star castPeacock's The Traitors returns for Season 4 with Alan Cumming and a star-studded cast from Survivor, Big Brother, Drag Race, and more. Filming is underway in the Scottish Highlands.

Country star Lauren Alaina gives birth to baby girl Beni Doll ArnoldCountry star Lauren Alaina and husband Cam Arnold welcomed their daughter, Beni Doll Arnold, on June 11. Alaina released a tribute song, "Heaven Sent," honoring her late father and newborn.

general news.headline: Israel hits Iran's refinery, warns of more attacks as Middle East crisis deepensIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Saturday vowed intensified strikes on Iran, declaring that "what they have felt so far is nothing compared with what they will be handed in the coming days", while Tehran accused Israel of pushing the region into a "dangerous cycle of violence".

Thrust not achieved, falling, Mayday: Air India pilot's last messages before crashThe Air India pilot of the London-Ahmedabad flight sent distress messages to Ahmedabad Air Traffic Control (ATC) before the crash, sources said. Messages like "thrust not achieved", "falling", and "Mayday" were sent by the Air India pilot as the flight crashed into a medical hostel minutes after takeoff, sources told India Today TV. The flight took off at 1.37 pm and crashed minutes later, killing at least 270 people.

US lawmaker shot dead, another injured, suspect dressed as cop escapesMinnesota Governor confirmed that Melissa Hortman and her husband were killed in what he described as a politically motivated assassination, while a second lawmaker and his wife were also shot and injured in the attack.

Shanghai group condemns Israel's strikes on Iran, India distances itselfThe SCO, a China-led regional bloc comprising member states including China, Iran, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Belarus, and India, had "strongly condemned" the Israeli military strikes on Iranian territory under Operation Rising Lion.

The 11A mystery: Two plane crashes, two lives spared, one seatRuangsak Loychusak was left shaken when he discovered that the sole survivor of the Air India crash was in seat 11A -- the same seat he had occupied when his Thai Airways flight went down in 1998.

Putin wishes Trump on birthday, discusses Iran-Israel conflict, Ukraine talksRussian President Vladimir Putin had called his US counterpart to wish him on his birthday. Both the leaders discussed the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran in the Middle East.

Minnesota shooter had 'manifesto' naming lawmakers, fled in cop-style SUVGovernor Tim Walz called the shootings a "politically motivated assassination" and confirmed that Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband were killed, while Senator John Hoffman was wounded.

C for Champions: South Africa end trophy drought, hammer Australia in WTC FinalWTC Final: Temba Bavuma-led South African team etched their names in history, winning the World Test Championship Final against Australia. This was South Africa's first ever ICC title in 27 years.
PETA India's 'dog milk' ad to push veganism leaves Internet queasy, not convincedPETA India's latest ad, showing a woman drinking a dog's milk to promote veganism, has sparked backlash online.

Use Hindi words instead of Urdu, Persian: Rajasthan's new directive to policeThe letter cites that despite the historical usage of Urdu and Persian terms in policing, dating back to the Mughal era, the current generation of police personnel and the general public lack familiarity with these languages.

Whistleblower flagged flaws in Boeing 787s sent to Air India a decade ago: ReportAccording to the report, two individuals with past ties to Boeing's Charleston plant described persistent quality issues with the aircraft dating back more than a decade.

Keir Starmer announces inquiry into grooming gangs who sexually exploited girlsKeir Starmer's announcement comes after Louise Casey, a former senior government official, conducted a "rapid audit" of the current scale and nature of gang-based child sexual exploitation in Britain.

Massive fire at 67-storey Dubai skyscrapper, over 3,800 evacuatedSpecialised firefighting and rescue units successfully evacuated all 3,820 residents from 764 apartments in the high-rise, ensuring that every individual was safely escorted out.

BCCI introduces new promotion-relegation rule in Ranji TrophyThe BCCI has announced a revamped 2025–26 Ranji Trophy with a phased schedule and new promotion rules. These changes aim to enhance competition quality and streamline domestic cricket tournaments.

Air India commits additional Rs 25 lakh to crash victims' families, survivorThis would be in addition to the Rs 1 crore compensation support to the families of each person announced earlier by Tata Sons.

Air India crash toll rises to 270, those injured at medical college hostel succumbThe death toll in Thursday's tragic Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad rose to 270, doctors said, as eight people from the medical hostel, where the London-bound flight crashed minutes after takeoff, were confirmed dead.

Are we living in spoiler-verse? Is pre-release content killing the hype for films?Is the film industry today grappling with overexposure, where trailers and promos reveal too much? Experts and filmmakers urge a balanced marketing approach to preserve the magic of discovery and keep viewers emotionally connected to the story.

Live: Iran launches new missile barrage, Israel responds with renewed strikesIsrael Iran War News Live: Iran and Israel exchanged airstrikes early Sunday. This comes after Israel launched its largest-ever offensive against its longtime rival in an effort to prevent it from developing nuclear weapons. Iran claimed that its latest wave of missile and drone strikes successfully hit Israeli military targets. In Israel, explosions have been reported as sirens blared across the Haifa and Kiryat regions. Earlier, Israel had initiated the first wave of attacks on Iran on Friday, followed by several more rounds, including a fresh wave on Saturday morning. At least 80 people have been reported killed till early Sunday, with dozens more injured in the ongoing strikes.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

No more bunny hop boundary catches: Cricket's new rule change explainedThe Marylebone Cricket Club, the custodians of the laws of the game, has announced a major update to cricket's boundary fielding law to ban multiple airborne touches. This change aims to make catches along the boundary rope fairer.

Madhya Pradesh couple's Taj Mahal-style 4BHK home is a treat for the eyes. Watch videoA Madhya Pradesh couple built a stunning 4BHK replica of the Taj Mahal inside a school, complete with marble interiors. Their viral home tour has left viewers speechless.

In satellite images and maps: Damages suffered by Iran and Israel in air warThe Israeli military has mounted a spectacular offensive against Iran, decapitating its top military leadership and dealing huge blows to Tehran's operational military capacity.

Trump military parade Live: 'No Kings' protests spread across US ahead of paradeUS military parade live updates: President Donald Trump will preside over a massive military parade in Washington on Saturday to mark the US Army's 250th anniversary, coinciding with his 79th birthday. The $25-$45 million spectacle will feature over 6,000 troops, 150 military vehicles including tanks, and 62 aircraft in a 90-minute display of US military history. Despite rainy weather forecasts and heightened security, the parade is set to proceed, culminating in a swearing-in ceremony and fireworks. 

Meanwhile, thousands of anti-Trump protesters are rallying in hundreds of cities nationwide for "No Kings" demonstrations, following several days of unrest over federal immigration raids. The protests have intensified in places like Los Angeles, where President Trump deployed the National Guard and US Marines despite opposition from California Governor Gavin Newsom.

Case against Supertech, promoters in Rs 126-crore IDBI Bank loan fraud caseAccording to the First Information Report (FIR), the accused are alleged to have submitted forged and fabricated documents to IDBI Bank to obtain credit facilities. Based on these falsified documents, the bank sanctioned loans which were later misused and diverted.

sports.headline: Cummins hints at top-order reset after WTC Final loss to South AfricaAfter Australia's WTC Final defeat to South Africa, captain Pat Cummins hinted at a possible batting reshuffle, acknowledging misfiring top-order concerns and opening the door for fresh faces in the new Test cycle.

BCCI forms panel to draft victory celebration norms after Bengaluru stampedeAfter the tragic stampede that killed 11 during RCB's IPL title celebrations in Bengaluru, the BCCI has stepped in with a dedicated panel to ensure safety protocols for future public victory events.

Arunachal's Hillang Yajik makes history with gold at bodybuilding championshipArunachal Pradesh's Hillang Yajik has created history by clinching 1 gold and 1 silver medal for India at the 15th South Asian Bodybuilding and Physique Sports Championships 2025, held in Thimphu, Bhutan. This is the first of a kind honour for an Indian woman in an international event.

Markram hopes WTC Final win helps reignite Test cricket in South AfricaAiden Markram's incredible 4th innings hundred guided South Africa to their first ICC trophy in 27 years. Markram hoped that the victory would reignite interest and prioritise Test cricket in the country.

AB de Villiers sees South Africa's triumph with kids, shares emotional tributeAB de Villiers witnessed South Africa create history in the World Test Championship with their win over Australia at Lord's. The former Proteas star shared a heartfelt tribute to the side after their legendary feat.

World domination in Test: Bavuma's next target after WTC triumphWTC Final: Temba Bavuma has already set his sights on his next target for South Africa. He aims to end their long-standing wait for Test wins in India and Pakistan after helping them win the WTC title.

Not easy being South Africa captain: Temba Bavuma basks in WTC gloryTemba Bavuma led South Africa to their first ICC title in 27 years, guiding the team through years of heartbreak to a historic World Test Championship win over Australia at Lord's.

India to warm-up for T20 World Cup 2026 with white-ball series vs New ZealandThe Indian cricket team will play an 8-match white-ball series against New Zealand in January 2026. This series is a key warm-up ahead of the T20 World Cup set to be hosted in India and Sri Lanka.

BCCI introduces new promotion-relegation rule in Ranji TrophyThe BCCI has announced a revamped 2025–26 Ranji Trophy with a phased schedule and new promotion rules. These changes aim to enhance competition quality and streamline domestic cricket tournaments.

Forget the divide, celebrate as one: Temba Bavuma's message to South AfricaWTC 2025 final: South Africa ended a 27-year wait for an ICC trophy when they defeated Australia by 5 wickets at Lord's on Saturday. Temba Bavuma heaped praise on his teammates and promised South Africa would celebrate the historic triumph as 'one'.

Aiden Markram came to the crease on a pair, returned as national heroAiden Markram's brilliant 136-run innings helped South Africa beat Australia in the World Test Championship final. His performance, along with Bavuma's leadership, secured South Africa's biggest chase at Lord's, ending Australia's decade-long final winning streak.

Temba Bavuma heaped praise on his teammates and promised South Africa would celebrate the historic triumph as 'one'.

His performance, along with Bavuma's leadership, secured South Africa's biggest chase at Lord's, ending Australia's decade-long final winning streak.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
